summary.blockquote: WARNINGWarning: Do not use this header. Browsers omit this header and servers should ignore it.

remarks.para: The Accept-Charset request HTTP header was a header that advertised a client's supported character encoding. It is no longer widely used.

UTF-8 is well-supported and the overwhelmingly preferred choice for character encoding. To guarantee better privacy through less configuration-based entropy, all browsers omit the Accept-Charset header.
Today, Accept-Charset is most notable for being one of several forbidden header names.

-HTTP content negotiation
-Accept-Charset is no more
-Header with the result of the content negotiation: Content-Type
-Other similar headers: TE, Accept-Encoding, Accept-Language, Accept
